result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:11 AM Defendant Yazmyne N Hooks in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Deft. does not have an atty.  SPD has contacted over 2000 attorneys.  BTC: County atty appointed at a repayment of $10/month beginning in 90 days.Finding of good cause to waive time limits.

from SPD, no attorney appointment as of today. 2332 contacts.
from SPD, no attorney appointment as of today.  2332 contacts.

***ALSO $10,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND***  Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail.

1:36 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Yazmyne N Hooks appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove appeared by video for Yazmyne N Hooks. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Matter is set for attorney status, defendant has not been appointed counsel yet. Defense asks to address bond.
State indicates they are okay to proceed. Defense is requesting a signature bond. State  is objecting.
BTC: SPD given more time to appoint counsel, matter adjourned. Court grants bond motion, Bond set at $2000 cash and $10,000 signature bond, no weapons and GPS monitoring  with only standard exceptions.
